attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
- 2/3 Final Salary Schemes in the private sector are closed to new entrants due to government regulation and tax changes.
- Neil Record(Institute of Economic Affairs), estimates public sector accrued pension liabilities at £1trillion in current value terms; equal to 1 year’s national income, £30,000 -£40,000 per household, 80% of GDP and twice the size of the official national debt.
- Public sector pension not backed by assets or recorded in national debt figures; unlike laws governing companies.
- Public sector pension costs will peak at £90billion/yr in 2045.
- An NHS worker or teacher pension benefits is about 40% of salary. A policewoman’s; 72% of salary.
- The PPS civil servant contribution rate is 3.5%, government contributes between 17.1% and 26.5%.
- 39% of local government employees and 68% of fire service employees retire early through ill health. 
- Public sector retirement age 60; basic state pension received from 65 to 68.
- 1 in 5 employed in the UK work for the public sector, most on final salary schemes. Only 1/3 of the private sector enjoys a FSS

We demand transparency(include liabilties in national debt figures) and reform (as per private sector).
